Title: OpenSSL: Certificate validation error
Synopsis:
An error in the OpenSSL certificate chain validation might allow for
    spoofing attacks.

Background.Text: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

Description.Text: The Google Security Team reported that several functions incorrectly check the result after calling the EVP_VerifyFinal() function, allowing a malformed signature to be treated as a good signature rather than as an error. This issue affects the signature checks on DSA and ECDSA keys used with SSL/TLS.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability and spoof arbitrary names to conduct Man-In-The-Middle attacks and intercept sensitive information.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
